channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Is Systems Thinking? A Primer with Applications for Sustainable Investing
item.description: Systems thinking is gaining in popularity in many fields including economics, finance, and investment management. Learn what it means and how it's being applied to sustainable investing.

item.title: Rich Gen Zers and millennials are investing in jewelry, sneakers and fine wine instead of traditional assets, says Bank of America
item.description: And they feel better than anyone else about the state of the economy.

item.title: Book Review: My Value Creation Journey
item.description: Bartley J. Madden has produced a book that challenges business leaders and investment professionals to think outside the box systematically to solve difficult problems.

item.title: OneUnited Bank CEO: Ending slavery is the best economic decision America ever made
item.description: The decision to end slavery ultimately had the profound impact of making America the strongest country in the world, writes OneUnited Bank CEO Kevin Cohee.

item.title: Private Markets’ Governance: A New Era
item.description: Now that the SEC Private Fund Adviser rules have been struck down, it's incumbent on the industry to demonstrate how private ordering can work.

item.title: Prada bosses want to be more like Gen Z because ‘when you get older, you overthink and limit yourself’
item.description: The bosses at Prada disagree want to be more Gen Z. Why? Because 'youth is the future'.

item.title: The Interplay Between Cap Rates and Interest Rates
item.description: What is the relationship between cap rates and interest rates? It's not as straightforward as you may think.

item.title: Lowe's CEO went from earning $4.35 an hour at Target to being one of only 8 Black Fortune 500 CEOs with this strategy
item.description: “I had to find a way to differentiate myself,” Marvin Ellison said.

item.title: Still Misperceived? A Fresh Look at Bitcoin Volatility
item.description: Is Bitcoin considerably more volatile than other asset classes? It's important to approach this question analytically and with an open mind because perceptions do not always match reality.

item.title: The number of Black Fortune 500 CEOs is still abysmally low: could a DEI practice be to blame?
item.description: Corporations have touted their diversity initiatives, but may not be following through
